name: Radisson Blu Hotel Sandton, Johannesburg

reviews.title: Perfect place when travelling for business
reviews.text: Centrally located, brand new hotel with amazing view. The gym is the best in town fully equipped with the latest Technogym machines. Very good breakfast which is served in the Italian restaurant, recommended for lunch and dinner (try the fillet, no disappointments) as well. The rooms are spacious and clean. There are two swimming pools (external and internal) and a good spa. Perfect choice for business travellers.

Great location near standton shopping centre. Rooms very nicely furnished and huge beds. Food very good, lovely turkey and avocado wrap, milk puddings. Free wifi and conference rooms are well catered. Used the hotel spa which is very relaxing with a back massage I can still feel today!
reviews.title: Good business traveller choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first thing to be aware of is there are two Radisson Blu hotels in Sandton within one block of each other.This one being Radisson Blu Hotel Sandton and the other is Radisson Blu Gautrain Hotel.If you ended up at the wrong hotel not really a big issue as they are very close to one another.We took a taxi to the hotel and decided to take the Gautrain back to the airport.If you are arriving/departing during the day the Gautrain is a very safe, fast,clean and modern system.The Gautrain station is about a block from the hotel and the hotel has a free shuttle that will pick you up if you call.Our checkin hit a glitch when they did not have our reservation which had been made online with a third party website.It was resolved in a very timely and efficient manner and we were very pleased with the end result.This appeared to be a business hotel,the majority of the guests appeared to be business men/woman with very few children.The lobby is located on the 13th floor which was nice for security and you require your room key to access the elevator to the hotel rooms.At first the card system is a bit confusing but it doesn't take long to figure it out.The hotel itself is very modern and trendy located within the CBD of Sandton.Our room was very spacious,modern and comfortable with everything we needed.The free wi-fi worked fine with no service problems.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Service Concerns - Great Gym

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are a traveller who needs access to a gym when you travel you have won the lottery with this gym.By far the best gym you may ever have access to when staying in a hotel.Your stay gives you "free" access to the Planet Fitness Platinum Gym located on the 10th floor.This gym has absolutely everything and anything you could want for a great workout and its "free"!
reviews.title: When you have location you don't need to focus on detail
Quiet a disappointment
reviews.text: Not to say our stay was perfect we did encounter a couple of service concerns that the hotel needs to be aware of .The hotel offers a free shuttle to Nelson Mandela Square where you will find plenty of shopping and dining options.It is only a block away but at night they suggest you take the shuttle and not walk.We found two of three shuttle drivers to have no people skills and really seemed to have no interest in our questions or concerns.After taking the shuttle once we ended up walking to/from the mall just to avoid dealing with the shuttle drivers.The driver who took us to the Gautrain station when we checked out saved the day,he was amazing not sure what the problem was with the other two.

Difficult to review this hotel - stayed here on a business trip in 2012, and whilst the hotel was undoubtedly very chic/trendy with pretty decent service, I found the concept of having the bar in the lobby area a little soulless - not the kind of place where you can sit on your own nursing a drink and meeting some people, as it seems to empty out pretty early. As a regular solo business traveller, this is something important to me, but this is obviously a personal thing, and not necessarily a reflection on the hotel offering in terms of value for money. Depends on what you're looking for - very decent business hotel on the balance of things.
reviews.title: 3/5 or 5/5, depending on what you're looking for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Decent hotel, rooms were comfortable and fairly big. The restaurant was nice as well, being vegetarians we could get a nice veg curry. The hotel has a shuttle to the sandton mall which is very useful. The breakfast was also good.
reviews.title: Decent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed there for one night while in transit. The hotel is an 8 minute walk from the Gautrain, which takes you to the airport in 15 minutes. There is another Radisson Blu that is right across the street from the Gautrain station, which we would have preferred to stay at, purely for location's sake. The Radisson Blu Sandton's location is not bad, and they do offer a free shuttle.
reviews.title: Almost Perfect

reviews.text: Our room was very typical for a Radisson Blu, nice, light, very comfortable king bed and a beautiful bathroom. However, the shower had some issues. The soap dish was broken off (and missing), and the shower door wouldn't close. There was no separation or lip to keep the water in, so the bathroom floor flooded every time we showered.
reviews.title: Not as good as it looks

reviews.text: At check in, the front desk person showed us where the breakfast room was and what time it was served. He did not mention that there was an extra charge for it. Perhaps we should not have assumed, but for $170/nt, we expected it to be included in the price of the room. It wasn't included. The food was AWFUL. The hot food tasted funky, the sausages were dry and rubbery, the smoothies tasted strange, and the cold foods were just basic. The omelette chef was nowhere to be found when we were there. For over $20/pp, this was GROSSLY overpriced, especially since we hardly ate anything. This was the biggest regret of our stay. Stick to a light room service meal if your b/f is not included. We also ate dinner there the night before, but my main course was chewy and hard to swallow. I left half of it on the plate.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel
Service with a Smile
reviews.text: Super friendly service in a modern hotel. The checkin in is on the 13th floor, and the security is apparent and I guess warranted. Breakfast is extensive and the views from the 22 floor are far and wide. Air con works good, as does the free wifi. Bathroom is also a good size.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Raddison for 3 nights during our honeymoon. In terms of location, there are a few others which are more convientely located to tourist attractions such as the Sandton Sun or Interconnitental. Its very much a business hotel and a little out of the way - nothing in the general area to recommend it. Walking distance to the Gautrain and about 20 minutes walk to Nelson Mandela Square. The hotel does provide a shuttle but ist only available until 9:30pm so you will have to find your own way back if you stay there later.
reviews.title: Radisson Blu Sandton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a long day we unfortunately checked in on 22/1 and were upgraded as all standard rooms were booked.We were not told it was to a smoking suite!The smell was not too bad and we were tired so we stuck with it.We enquired about free internet use and were indicated 3 lap tops.Later we tried to get on line to our families but got no joy.When we enquired with customer relations nearby(who had seen us trying) we were told that the internet had been down for quite some time and the lap tops were not therefore in use.No other laptop/terminal was available.At breakfast we were ignored,with waiters too busy looking for tables to clear rather than customers to serve.It took 2 requests to get coffee.The hot choice I went for,beans,scrambled egg and sausages were all cold.Enough was enough.At checking out we asked for a feed back sheet to complain and stated our complaints.We were informed that we would be e-mailed a feed -back form.......a week later now.....no form.We will not use a Radisson again.
reviews.title: Very Poor Service

reviews.text: I absolutely love this hotel! I stayed there twice in December 2012 and was so happy to come back to see the friendly faces and very nice and helpful people. The buffet breakfast was lovely and I made sure I made it there everymorning. The rooms are big and homey, the view of the park was nice, the pool very relaxing and the spa was top notch. Overall this is the best place to stay in Jo'burg.
reviews.title: Best Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently had a lovely stay at the Radisson. I generally love the decor and service in these hotels, but one thing I've noticed is that certainly with the ones in South Africa, maintenance is really not up to scratch. Everything looks a little bit used and neglected. They have a very nice spa though and the breakfast is good value for money.
reviews.title: Doesn't live up to 5-star expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh dear. My approach is usually to review good hotels here - the ones where there are issues I seek to resolve with the hotel and if resolved well then we keep quite about in the hope that it was a blip and not a habit. This is a rare review.
reviews.title: Perhaps one of the worst hotel experience ever

reviews.text: We would regard our stay at the Radisson Blu as 'unpleasant'. From the moment we arrived (after a five hour drive) the service was so far below expectations from such a hotel, as well as the type of service we had experienced over two weeks in South Africa to leave our jaws pretty much on the floor.
reviews.title: Might just be the best hotel ever for me

reviews.text: Whilst there was a problem with the booking (Agoda had failed to send through updated details, out of our control) we were made to feel as if the whole problem was our fault, to the extent that we felt as if the hotel thought we were trying to con them out of a night there. This was despite having copies of the updated paperwork on e mail.
reviews.title: Good business stay

reviews.text: Even before we were left standing at the desk whilst the first member of staff nonchalantly began dealing with it for some 10 minutes, we had not even greeted with a smile or general pleasantries. There is something seriously wrong with staff training here. We may have booked via a discounter but we were still paying US$275 for this privilege. And even if we had US$25, there is no excuse for such behavior. A second, equally disengaged member of staff got involved and eventually we were given a key to our room leaving US to apologize to THEM for the inconvenience. Far too British for sure...
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with an amazing view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once in the room, they are pleasant enough (albeit this one opposite the lifts which is never ideal). Large with room to unpack and a good sized bathroom. However, on opening the wardrobe there were no bathrobes. Completely empty. What do we need to do to get the basics.
reviews.title: A Great Stay
